headline: Adobe’s new pricing tiers likely included in guidance, says Barclays
summary: Adobe (ADBE) announced new tiers for its Creative Cloud Franchise, Pro and Standard, which are set to take effect on June 17 for individuals, students and teachers, and teams, Barclays analyst Saket Kalia tells investors in a research note. The firm thinks the new tiers for Creative Cloud should come as no surprise following previews of this move at Adobe’s MAX analyst day last fall and believes the pricing tiers are included in its fiscal 2025 guidance of 11% year over year annual recurring rev

headline: Adobe announces price increases for Creative Cloud apps
summary: Adobe (ADBE) on Thursday said that Creative Cloud for individuals plans are changing for customers in North America on June 17. “At Adobe, we’re always evolving our products to make them better for our customers, and we’ve continued to build new features and enhance product workflows and performance. We’re also expanding your toolbox to better support your creative process – from ideation through to final delivery. The Creative Cloud plans for subscribers in North America (United States, Canada,

headline: Adobe price hikes make 2025 guidance conservative, says Jefferies
summary: Jefferies says Adobe (ADBE) yesterday announced prices for Creative Cloud All Apps will increase to $70 per month from $60 for the individual version and to $100 from $90 for the Teams plans. The firm is positive on the news. While already embedded in Adobe’s fiscal 2025 outlook. the price hikes increase confidence in the company hitting its revenue, the analyst tells investors in a research note. The firm says these plans should complement Firefly and enhance Adobe’s role in artificial intellig
